result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A. Leseberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 73 days if revoked.
Concurrent with: All probation is concurrent to each other on each sentence.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard A. Leseberg

records.addlTxt: Court calls  @  11:00 am. Defendant Richard A. Leseberg in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def. requesting no contact with J.S. be lifted.  Def. gives argument.  State objects and gives argument.  Def. wants to see daughter.  Court explains and refers to 11FA111 order.  Def. needs to modify placement in divorce case.  Court denies request.  Def. makes statement.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on January 25, 2018 at 10:30 am.

Letter to Judge Rhode from counsel
(forwarded to JA)
Plea & Sentencing 6-1-17
Victim List
DNA Proof of Submission

Court calls 16CF73 & 16CF18 @ 3:20 pm. Defendant Richard A. Leseberg in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Defendant Richard A. Leseberg in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives plea agreement, 16CF73, ct 1, ct 2, DRI 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 10, plea to ct 11, DRI 12 13 & 14, 16CF18, plea to ct 1, DRI 2-5, 16CF73 ct 1 withheld sentence 4 years probation, 1 yr jail, costs, DNA surcharge, no contact with JS and D.B., counseling deemed necessary by agent, ct 2 withheld sentence  4 years probation, costs, DNA Surcharge, no contact, counseling, ct 11 same as ct 2. 16CF18 ct 1 impose 6 prison, 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, stay 4 yrs probation, concurrent, costs, DNA surcharge, no contact, counseling, No Restitution by victims.  State has complied with victim rights. 16CF18 P.H. held, 16CF73 P.H. held.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights. Def. understands charges and penalties.  16CF73 ct 1 Theft, special facts, Guilty, ct 2 Poss of firearm, Guilty, ct 11 Bailjumping, Guilty 16CF18 ct 1 Forgery, Guilty plea. 16CF73 DRI ct's 3-10 & 12-14, 16CF18 DRI Ct's 2-5.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights. Def. understands elements. Def. admits prior convictions. Atty Grubofski is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given. Factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty in 16CF73 Theft, special facts in ct 1, Felon Poss firearm in ct 2, Bailjumping felony in ct 11 and 16CF18 ct 1 Forgery-Uttering, repeater. State gives sentencing recommendation. 16CF73 Victim Impact statement filed.  Credit time parties are unsure and will file stipulation for jail credit. 16CF18 73 days credit, 16CF73 75 days credit. Atty Grubofski gives sentencing statement. Victims Mr. & Mrs. K present in courtroom. Def. makes statement. 
Court orders on 16CF73 ct 1 withheld sentence 4 years probation, 1 yr jail, huber privileges, costs, DNA Sample, 250 DNA surcharge, no contact with J.S. and D.B., counseling deemed necessary by agent, 75 days credit if revoked, reserve right to stipulate
ct 2 withheld sentence  4 years probation, costs, waive DNA Surcharge, no contact with JS and DB, counseling, 
ct 11 withheld sentence  4 years probation,  costs, waive DNA Surcharge, Same conditions in ct 1
16CF18 ct 1 impose 6 prison, 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, stay 4 yrs probation, All probation is concurrent to each other on each sentence, costs, 250  DNA surcharge, Same conditions, 73 days credit if revoked, reserve right to stipulate.  Def. is not eligible for Challenge and is eligible for substance abuse program. Def. advised of firearm and voting rights.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights. Cash bond arguments. Atty Grubofski oppose to forfeit.  Court will forfeit any bonds that are being held and moved to forfeit.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

Bail Bond
No contact with D.D. and J.S.

Court calls 16CF18, 16CF73 & 16FO343  @ 1:28 pm.  Defendant Richard A. Leseberg in court, in custody, via-video.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16FO343 Theft of Library Materials, Def. makes statement.  no contest plea.  Finding Guilty and orders $375.45 total with Restitution. Def. needs to get under p.p. Court vacates warrant. Send to jail. 16CF18 & 16CF73 - Def. spoke to atty. State gives statement.  Court still holding $500.00 on each case.  Warrant vacated.  State heard on bond recommendation.  Def. heard on bond. Court orders $2,000.00 cash bond w/conditions to cover both files. Def. heard on conditions.  Status conference scheduled for April 10, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Richard A. Leseberg not in court.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 16CF18 & 16CF73. Court has received a letter from Counsel.  Court will grant adjournment.  No new date.  Court will hold rulings on bond forfeitures.
Attached Documents - Copies of documents provided to DA

Attorney Gavin Grubofski in court.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CF18 & 16CF73 @  2:03 pm.  Atty Grubofski gives statement and does not except def. to appear for todays hearing.  State request warrant for body only and moves court to forfeit bonds.  Court orders warrant body only. Court forfeits bonds reserve def's rights pending hearing.

Defendant Richard A. Leseberg in court, via video, in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin Called at 11:45 am.  Def before the court on a warrant.  Def has copy of complaint.  Court reviews charges with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an atty.  State request cash bond, reasons given.  Court questions def as to employment.  Court sets bond.  Case may be called sooner if atty is on case.  Warrant vacated  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
